title: How to Make Pumpkin Truffles

steps.headline: Place the pureed pumpkin, brown sugar, and spices into the saucepan.
steps.description: Cook for 5 to 6 minutes. Stir occasionally. The cooking is done when the mixture has reduced and the pumpkin is dry. Remove from the heat and leave to stand.

steps.headline: Pour in the cream in another saucepan.
steps.description: Bring the cream to a boil, then remove immediately.

steps.headline: Pour the hot cream into the bowl.
steps.description: Add the chocolate and let it melt in untouched for a minute. Then, stir gradually from the center of the bowl to the outer edge. Once mixed well, add the pumpkin mixture made earlier and gently stir through. Add the butter and mix in. Pour in the liqueur or juice and mix through.

steps.headline: Place the bowl of truffle mixture, covered, into the refrigerator for at least an hour to chill.
Create the truffles.
steps.description: Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. Using a melon baller, form small balls from the pumpkin truffle mixture and arrange the balls in rows on the lined cookie sheet. Return to the refrigerator to chill for another hour.

steps.headline: Melt chocolate using a double boiler.
steps.description: Take the truffle balls out of the refrigerator and dip each ball in the melted chocolate. Use a chocolate/candy dipping tool to make this easier. Ensure that each ball is completely coated in chocolate.

steps.headline: Roll covered balls in cocoa.
steps.description: The pumpkin truffles are now ready to serve or box for gift giving.

Remove from the heat and leave to stand. Pour in the cream in another saucepan. Bring the cream to a boil, then remove immediately. Pour the hot cream into the bowl. Add the chocolate and let it melt in untouched for a minute. Then, stir gradually from the center of the bowl to the outer edge. Once mixed well, add the pumpkin mixture made earlier and gently stir through. Add the butter and mix in. Pour in the liqueur or juice and mix through. Place the bowl of truffle mixture, covered, into the refrigerator for at least an hour to chill.  Create the truffles. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. Using a melon baller, form small balls from the pumpkin truffle mixture and arrange the balls in rows on the lined cookie sheet. Return to the refrigerator to chill for another hour. Melt chocolate using a double boiler. Take the truffle balls out of the refrigerator and dip each ball in the melted chocolate. Use a chocolate/candy dipping tool to make this easier. Ensure that each ball is completely coated in chocolate. Roll covered balls in cocoa. The pumpkin truffles are now ready to serve or box for gift giving.
